lines.text: Now, just a minute, Gregory, D.C.'s a cat! He can't help his instincts. He's a hunter, just like you are. Only he's not stupid enough to stand out in the pouring rain all day!
Good night, old woman, I can't hear a word you're saying, but whatever it is, I disagree with you one hundred percent!
You mean you want me to tail the cat as if he's a person?
Unless it would be easier to tail him as a cat.
You'll do nothing. You'll get Tom Swift, or whoever that is, and his electric scoreboard, or whatever that thing is, out of my room or I'm going to call the police.
Be careful Gregory, be extremely careful about what you say! I haven't had my coffee yet, and I'm in no mood for stupid, irresponsible remarks.
Oh.
Hold it! Who do you think you're kidding?
What do you mean?
You think I don't know what's going on upstairs?
You do?
I didn't come in from Stupidsville on last night's bus! You've got a woman in that apartment.
Wow, hold it! What kind of talk is that?
Don't double-talk me! I've got ears, haven't I?
It's Dan's mother, you see she came down all un-expected like.
I don't care if it's Pocahontas!

[Patti answers the door to him, when making an intrusive knock]
Okay, where's the duck?
I beg your pardon?

[Gregory Benson then shouted extremely loud saying]
I want my duck!
Your duck?
If you please...
I'm sorry, Gregory, but I really don't know what you are talking about.
Ooh! Where is that sneaky, miserable guttersnipe! He's got my duck!
What duck?
Say!
Shush!
What do you mean shush? This is my room!
Patti! I'm gonna have to ask you to quiet down, and that goes for you too!
[first meeting of Zeke Kelso & Ingrid Randall]
Why, hello there.
Who are you! How do you get off telling me to be quiet in my own room!
[Zeke Kelso then pulled out his FBI badge, to show to show it to Ingrid Marshall]
What's this thing supposed to be, I don't know anything about that stuff.
Canoe, this is just a wild idea, but has it occurred to you that there might be more to life than just surfing and eating?
Like what?
Forget it, I just realized I was talking to myself.
Miss Randall, I'm afraid you underestimate me. We shall proceed with the pawprinting.
You know, that fellow has the most attractive way of putting his foot in his mouth. What did you say his name is?
Couldn't we just once see a nice quiet movie where boy meets girl, they have problems which aren't too weird, they fall in love and live happily ever after?
Now, why would you wanna see a lot of unhealthy stuff like that?
I don't know. Maybe just for once, I'd like to go to a movie where I don't get seasick.
All right, I'll make you a deal. Well, you go with me to the drive-in Thursday night, and next week I'll take you to one of those happily-ever-after clambakes. Deal?
I guess.
Where's the 'thing' playing?
Oh, who knows, maybe they don't even make movies like that anymore.
Well sure, and you want to know why? Because people don't wanna be depressed by all that slop.
I wouldn't make a break. I wouldn't do it. I wouldn't.
[Margaret Miller then holds her hands together, for mercy]
Okay. But I've got friends. I've got ten little lead-nosed friends in here, and they all run faster than you do, Moms.
Watch the crumbs, will you fellas?

[Canoe then immitated Patti, to DC]
Pass the word, watch the crumbs.
[Canoe then sweept the crumbs under the couch, and wiped his hands off, on the Randall's drapes]
Can you imagine his wife? Mrs. Zeke Kelso... sounds like something that got caught in a clothes dryer.
Gadzooks, you're bleeding!
Oh, it's nothing, probably just an artery.
Do you have any regulars, or people going in and out of the house all the time?
Father always complained that we were running a rehab center for punch-drunk juveniles.
Come on, back in the house, snoopy.
Oh, I don't know what's gotten into me, I'm all churned up inside!
I'll tell you what. Why don't you go over to the snack-stand and get yourself a nice pizza. to settle your stomach.

[whining tone]
I don't feel like a pizza!
Well, for Pete's sake, will you stop grumbling and watch the movie?

[Canoe lost his temper]
Oh, all these surfing pictures look alike!

[to Margaret Miller]
Well, don't just stand there flappin' your ears, Mom. Make with the cooking.

[at Patti's front door, he suddenly hears a loud shriek of a man]
What was that?
What was what?
That blood-curdling scream.
Canoe, will you just go?
Oh, I'm terribly sorry, I didn't realize I was butting in on a murder.

[Canoe was knocking on Patti's front door, while Zeke was being pawprinting DC]
Oh, Canoe!

[Zeke Kelso then thought Patti asked "Can you"? after hearing Patti say Canoe's name]
Can I what?

[Patti just discovered Margaret Miller's wristwatch, around DC's neck]
D.C.'s wearing a wristwatch.
What's the matter? Well, well, what will that sweet innocent cat be bringing home next? The Hope Diamond, I imagine.
[after Iggy turns fan on to clear away the smoke, the numerous dollar bills of money start flying out of the suitcase]

[irately, after turning fan off]
What goes on in that pea brain of yours?

[weak smile]
I forgot about the loot! Forgot. Forgot.

[Inkie is Patti's nickname to Ingrid]
Have a nice day, at the office, Inkie.
Patti, you've got that terrible "butter-won't-melt-in-your-mouth" expression. I know what's going on, in your tiny little mind and I absolutely forbid it.

[just after walking into drive-in]
I bet you've got a lot of mice, in here.
Sir, a mouse is no more permitted in here, than a man without a car.
So, this is the
[sneeze]
"informant", as we say down at the office.
[last lines]

[to the policemen that just brought her home]
You might as well wait for me.
[much louder voice]
I'm going into the house to murder someone!

[as she starts to walk to the house]
Oh, Wilbur, don't try to hide. Come out and take your medicine like a man. Wilbur!
[when Wilbur MacDougall, heard Kipp's voice and threatening remark, he quickly grabbed his hat and ran away out the back door to avoid being seen by Kipp. Then the movie closing credits begin]
40,000 pads in this town and you gotta to pick one over a human radar set! Not only that, shes got a sister visiting who don't sleep good 'cause she's the head roach at the state birdhouse!
[raises voice]
Nice?
Hey, it was a quarter million, wasn't it?
[Margaret Miller, gagged, shook her head, no]
Two hundred grand?
[Margaret Miller, gagged, shook her head, no again]
Not one lousy hundred and sixty?
[Margaret Miller, gagged, nodded her head, yes this time]
[Iggy then made a fist, threatening to hit Margaret Mitchell in her mouth, but Dan prevented it]

[to Margaret Miller]
Make mine well. I can't stand the sight of blood.

[to Margaret Miller]
Some desperate character I got for a partner, huh Mom?

[Patty is inside Hofstedder's Jewelry Store, just before she called the FBI as 'Daphne Hofstedder' with accented voice]
Now, I know you very well, and you're a sweet man and you would never forgive yourself if something terrible happened to Margaret Miller, and it could. I can just see it in the newspaper headlines "Mister Hofstedder, He Could Have Saved Her".

[accent]
This is Daphne Hofstedder speaking, of Hofstedder's Jewelry Store, 1833 West Mapleton Avenue.
Yes, Miss Hofstedder, how may I help you?

[accent]
I heard you were looking for information, concerning a certain watch.
Yes, we are.

[accent]
Well, a couple of weeks ago, a woman came into the shop, to buy a band, for her watch. Uh, what was the name? Oh, Miss Margaret Miller.
Margaret Miller? Will you describe this band you sold to Miss Miller?

[accent]
Seventeen jewels, rather rectangular shaped, with raised filigree... things on the face.
Rectangular with raised filigree. Miss Hofstedder, may I ask why you haven't come forward earlier, with this information?

[accent]
Well, I was away on my holiday... to Mexico... on a bus.
Will you be in town, Miss Hofstedder?

[accent]
Yes. I'll be here anytime you want to talk to me, on the phone.
Thank you very much for your information. Goodbye.
[Zeke Kelso then hung up telephone]

[Patti's phone call restarted Zeke Kelso's temporarily stopped job of following DC Randall that lead to the rescue of kidnapped banker Margaret Miller, later in the same evening and solved the FBI issue]

[to Patty, after she entered his jewelry store & just before her call to resume the FBI's following DC that rescued Margaret Miller later that evening]
Do I look like Eliot Ness?
I'm speaking for Mister Kelso, at 626 double-o 2 5.
Did you make a call to this number, a few moments ago?

[whispering to Patti, it's the FBI]
Yes. Yes, that was us. She sold it, she's from Mexico. I'm Mr. Hofstedder. The wristband, my neice sold it, she's from Mexico.
[after the phone call ends]
I wonder what they meant, when they said they wouldn't forget me.
[then he covers his mouth, as if in fear]
[arguing with Dan and Iggy when a $20 bill starts to fall from the ceiling, to her]
And I don't care, this is gonna cost you.
[a twenty-dollar bill fell into her hands but Iggy quickly & quietly pickpocketed it back]
Twenty bucks! Well, I guess that makes us even.
[first lines, after introductory song concluded]

[as Iggy buys four different newspapers, Iggy sees DC smelling the salmon, he had just purchased]
Hey, what do you say fella? Hey, you're taking my food, huh?
[looking out a window]

[Dan pulled Margaret Miller, away from window]
Back away from that window!
[Margaret Miller retreats back]

[to Iggy who's oblivious reading a newspaper]
Why don't you just let her stick her head out the window and yell for help, you meathead?

[still oblivious]
What'd I do?

[immediately after Kipp MacDougall left the house to snoop, Wilbur MacDaogall went to the telephone, to call the police, on her!]
I always say, if you got a duty, you ought to do it.

[speaking to the telephone operator]
Get me the police.

[after operator connected him to the police]
Police? I want to report a prowler. Yeah, he's dressed like an old woman. Running around, looking in windows. No telling what he's up to. Yeah, and tell your men to be careful. He's dangerous!

[Patti, to FBI Supervisor Newton, while he is at the Marshall's house one evening, speaking of DC]
He's really diabolically clever.
[DC are initials of Darn Cat! and Diabolically Clever!]
[after seeing DC again]

[happily]
Hey, fella, where did you come from, huh? I got a little business to do, then I'll give you some milk.

[by DC's collar, after DC went in the apartment building, Zeke Kelso located Margaret Miller's kidnappers, hearing Dan's remark]
Get rid of that cat, go in and finish her off.
Think it's better to do the job here, or in the truck?
Here. So we don't have to fight her down the stairs.
This is it Control, 1-3-2 Eighth Street.
132 Eighth Street]
Kelso, you hold off 'til we get there.

[upon hearing Margaret Miller's voice]
I can't wait sir. I've got a situation, that's breaking wide open.

[looking under Ingrid Mershall's bed]
That
[sneeze]
cat!
[after first evening of following DC, DC lead the four agents, Spires, Graham, Kelly & Cahill back to the Randall's home]
We have to cooperate.

Of course we do but the FBI has gotten along all these years without using my room as a base of operation. Right? Now, I want Mr. Whoever-he-is, and his ham radio or whatever that is, out of my room by the time I get home, or I'm going to become very difficult.

[Patti quickly walks out her front door]
Do you want to miss Night of the Surfer, starring Git Gladsby, "King of the Roaring Surf"?
[as DC is near the front door opening]
Get out of here!
[he then shuts his business door]
Spires, Graham, Graham & Cahill, as Kelso is informing them that DC is a cat that may trail the two criminals]
Whither he goest, you will go.
[Patti picked up the spare micrphoned cat collar and takes Ingrid to another room, in their house, for Zeke Kelso to find her, with the FBI locating device]

[Ingrid speaking with microphoned spare cat collar]
Mister Kelso... if you don't mind, let's get going.
Be patient, it's not nine o'clock yet.

[just as Zeke Kelso sneezed]
Let's get going.

[Zeke Kelso acted as he thought the cat really spoke English]
Now, wait a minute. Let's pull ourselves together, here a minute.

[louder and angrily]
Patti, you little wretch, let m out of here, I'm suffocating!
Oh.

[Ingrid angrily pounds on the closet door]
Hey!
[Ingrid pounds on the closet door again]
Let me out of here!
I'll get you out. Patti's gone to the movies.
Gone to the movies?
There's something that seems to be stuck here.
Well, open it. There's no air, I'm suffocating!
Yeah, well don't worry, I'll go get a screwdriver.
I'm suffocating! Get me out of here!

[DC starts to leave the house]
I'm sorry, I've got to follow it.
Don't you dare follow that cat! Let me out of here! There's no air!
I'll be back. Probably just an hour or two. Lie down on the floor, there's usually more air down there.
[Zeke Kelso then tried waving air through the door, to Ingrid]
I'm gonna scream!
Worst thing you can do. It uses up all the air.

[Ingrid Marshall screamed extremely loud and hard]
I distinctly heard a woman scream.
Right.
[Wilbur MacDougall grabbed Kipp MacDougall's arm to keep her at the kitchen sink]
If you don't keep away, you're going to hear another.

[DC left the house, while Zeke Kelso on dis-connecting the closet door hinges, that Ingrid was apparently locked in]
Okay, push.
[the closet door opens, knocking Zeke Kelso onto the bed, behind him]
I'd have that latched fixed. Especially, if you go in there a lot. Excuse me, but I've got to run. I just hope I haven't lost the cat.

[as Ingrid catches her breath, she speaks irately]
Go ahead and follow that cat. And when you find him, do me a favor. The both of you just stay there!

[shortly after Zeke Kelso freed Ingrid Marshall from the locked closet, he starts his search for DC, and DC is next to a motor cylist, that is about to start the engine]
Oh!
[Zeke Kelso's remark was from the motorcycle starting]
[the motorcycle driver, starting its engine almost broke, injured or deafened Zeke Kelso's ear drum]
